New Records: Bas De Leede took four scalps against Pakistan at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 to match Tim De Leede's efforts against India in 2003 and become the first father-son duo with four-wicket hauls at World Cups
Saud Shakeel's half-century off 32 balls is the second-fastest fifty for Pakistan in the history of the Men's Cricket World Cup
Key Match Events: Haris Rauf was the pick of Pakistan bowlers, with his 3/43
Hasan Ali picked up two wickets
Bas de Leede top-scored for the Netherlands with 67
Saud Shakeel and Mohammad Rizwan both scored 68 for Pakistan
Shadab Khan broke the threatening stand between Vikramjit Singh and de Leede in the 24th over
Rauf's double-wicket over brought the game back into Pakistan's side
De Leede scored 67 from 68, hitting six fours and two sixes
Logan van Beek hit some lusty blows but the Netherlands tail was cleaned up by the 41 over mark
Max O' Dowd fell for 5 in an attempt to pull Hasan Ali for a six
Colin Ackermann was bowled by Iftikhar Ahmed in the 12th over
Aryan Dutt got the better of Saud Shakeel in the 29th over
De Leede bowled Mohammad Rizwan and Iftikhar Ahmed in the same over
De Leede cleaned up Shadab Khan and trapped Hasan Ali lbw in the 44th over
Fakhar Zaman fell for 12 after gifting van Beek a return catch
Babar Azam mistimed a pull against Ackermann and fell for five
Imam-ul-Haq was caught by Aryan Dutt at fine leg in the 10th over
Rizwan and Shakeel brought up their 100-run partnership in the 25th over
Pre-Game Insights: Netherlands skipper Scott Edwards called it right at the toss and the Dutch opted to field against Babar Azam's Pakistan
Pakistan have a perfect head-to-head record of 6-0 over Netherlands in the ODI format
Abdullah Shafique found no place as Pakistan went for their usual top three
Netherlands have high hopes of making an impact at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 starting with their clash against Pakistan
Miscellaneous Highlights: Hyderabad bore witness to a brilliant display from the Pakistan bowling attack
The Dutch were all out for 205 in reply to Pakistan's score of 286
Pakistan overcame an early scare to beat Netherlands at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023
The surface was holding its line on occasions and taking turn on other
Pakistan added 34 runs for the last two wickets but couldn't finish their quota of overs
